intro: Sida tasmanica, commonly known as Tasmanian sida, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. Sida tasmanica is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand salt spray and coastal conditions.
